name: Classic Eggs Benedict
steps:
Fill a large, wide pot with 3 inches of water. Add white vinegar and bring to a gentle simmer (not boiling).
While water heats, split English muffins and toast until golden brown. Keep warm.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and warm Canadian bacon or ham slices for 2-3 minutes per side until lightly browned. Keep warm.
To make hollandaise sauce: Melt butter in a small saucepan and clarify by skimming off the white foam. Keep warm but not hot.
In a double boiler or heatproof bowl set over simmering water, whisk egg yolks with lemon juice until pale and thickened, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove from heat and slowly drizzle in warm clarified butter while whisking constantly until sauce is smooth and emulsified.
Season hollandaise with cayenne pepper and salt. Keep warm in a bowl set over warm (not hot) water.
To poach eggs: Crack one egg into a small bowl. Create a gentle whirlpool in the simmering water with a spoon.
Slide the egg into the center of the whirlpool. Poach for 3-4 minutes until white is set but yolk is still runny.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Repeat with remaining eggs.
To assemble: Place toasted English muffin halves on plates. Top each with a slice of Canadian bacon, then a poached egg.
Spoon hollandaise sauce over each egg, garnish with chives and a sprinkle of paprika.
Serve immediately while hot.
